lines.text: [To Nelly as a sommelier pours her wine at a fancy restaurant]
[To Nelly, as he hands her the conclusion of his manuscript]
Here's the end. Read it, make cuts, but spare the sentences I like. You'll recognize them. They're underlined.
We struck it rich in real estate, making Paris ugly.
You reach an age when you read the same few books over and over.
Marry an old man like me and you'll have liberty, security, and austerity.

[Speaking of his computer]
"I wanted to use it once and erased everything."
It's easy. You want to see? It's a typewriter with memory.
That's what's scary. A memory without memories.

[In a fancy restaurant]
There are more waiters than customers here.
That explains the prices. You saved my life,
